metadata.title: CVE-2013-2882 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 28.0.1500.95, allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified otherimpact via vectors that leverage "type confusion."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2882` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 29.0.1547.65-0ubuntu2
chromium-browser-l10n - 29.0.1547.65-0ubuntu2
chromium-chromedriver - 29.0.1547.65-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 29.0.1547.65-0ubuntu2
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 29.0.1547.65-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '29.0.1547.65-0ubuntu2').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
